item.title: PLU Decomposition
item.description: Definitions 1 2 For a permutation matrix $P^{T}$ and an invertible matrix $A \in \mathbb{R}^{n \times n}$, the matrix multiplication $P^{T} A$ gives us the product $LU$. This decomposition is referred to as the PLU decompositionPermutation LU Decomposition of $A$. Since $P$ is a permutation matrix, it is also an orthogonal matrix, that is $P^{-1} = P^{T}$, hence it can be written like this: $$ P^{T} A = LU \iff
